data.title: Decompose RenderInfantry into WithInfantryBody and RenderSprites.
data.body:
Followup to #3348.  This untangles the default (body) sprite from `RenderSprites` for infantry.

A future PR can now make this implement `UpgradableTrait` and switch the infantry artwork based on an external condition (RA2 GIs / thumpers / TS cyborgs).

data.title: add /lib to lua search path in configure script
data.body: the title says it all - if Lua is installed with prefix that is "/" instead of "/usr" the search will fail.

data.title: Redalert: AI attacks wall
data.body:
If you have a team game with several AIs, you just have to build a wall next to your base. AI tries to attack the wall first while you can easily kill them. So plz change attack priority for AIs, instead of first trying to attack walls change to attack enemy units. 
Thx
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9397936-redalert-ai-attacks-wall?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Gif loader

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This adds a sprite loader for gif files, if the gif is animated it will parse all the frames and you will be able to access them as you do with the shp files.

This also includes a test piece showing it in action, enjoy seeing my inept drawing skills in action :P

data.title: Add some documentation to support powers.
GiveBuildableArea types.
data.body:
Allow GiveBuildableArea actors to extend the build radius for certain Buildings via RangeType and a Ranges dictionary.

Example in RA2:

``` diff
diff --git a/rules/structures.yaml b/rules/structures.yaml
index bb44ddb..b0a0f42 100644
--- a/rules/structures.yaml
+++ b/rules/structures.yaml
@@ -92,6 +92,7 @@ gapile:
        Queue: Building
        BuildPaletteOrder: 20
        Prerequisites: anypower, ~structures.allies
+       RangeType: barracks
    Selectable:
        Bounds: 134, 132, 0, -28
    Valued:
@@ -491,6 +492,7 @@ nahand:
        Queue: Building
        BuildPaletteOrder: 20
        Prerequisites: anypower, ~structures.soviets
+       RangeType: barracks
    Valued:
        Cost: 300
    Tooltip:
@@ -570,6 +572,35 @@ narefn:
    Power:
        Amount: -50

+caoutp:
+   Inherits: ^Building
+   Buildable:
+       Queue: Building
+       BuildPaletteOrder: 1000
+       Prerequisites: anypower
+       RangeType: tech
+   GivesBuildableArea:
+       Ranges:
+           barracks: 9
+   Building:
+       Footprint: xxx= xxx= xxx=
+       Dimensions: 4,3
+   Valued:
+       Cost: 1000
+   Selectable:
+       Bounds: 170, 150, -6, -30
+   Tooltip:
+       Name: Tech Outpost
+       Description: Allows building barracks up to 9 cells away.
+   Health:
+       HP: 2000
+   Armor:
+       Type: Concrete
+   RevealsShroud:
+       Range: 6c0
+   WithIdleOverlay@middle:
+       Sequence: idle-middle
+
 anypower:
    Tooltip:
        Name: Power Plant
diff --git a/sequences/structures.yaml b/sequences/structures.yaml
index a20e1d4..2246d72 100644
--- a/sequences/structures.yaml
+++ b/sequences/structures.yaml
@@ -562,3 +562,21 @@ narefn:
        # UseTilsetCode: true # TODO: pchote/ts-snow
    icon: nreficon
        Start: 0
+
+caoutp:
+   idle: ctoutp
+       Start: 0
+       ShadowStart: 3
+   damaged-idle: ctoutp
+       Start: 1
+       ShadowStart: 4
+   idle-middle: ctoutp_d
+       Start: 1
+       ShadowStart: 2
+   damaged-idle-middle:
+       Start: 2
+       ShadowStart: 3
+   make: ctoutp
+       Start: 0
+   icon: nreficon
+       Start: 0
```

**Help wanted label**:
The logic seems right and plays well, but will BaseProvider or Building.Adjacent need to be adjusted?
Also math.

data.title: Conditional sequence enable/disable.
data.body:
TS and RA2 will need this.

Examples being the GDI radar and the Allied service depot (and conyards).

data.title: Rework sequence parsing.
data.body:
This adds the plumbing which will be used in future prs to fix #5272, #4823, and add support for the facing reflection needed by #3274.

This is a pure plumbing patch, so there should be no changes ingame.  My [ts-snow](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/ts-snow) branch demonstrates how this this will be used to implement stricter terrain-specific artwork for RA/TD (and will eventually include a utility command to verify sequence correctness), remove redundancy from D2K, and add the snow tileset to TS.  809215c956620ac8f6d89e7f4784d62768f94596 is the most important one to see how these will work.

data.title: Crash on current bleed in the Move activity
data.body:
```
Available mods:
    cnc: Tiberian Dawn (git-762c0e1)
    d2k: Dune 2000 (git-762c0e1)
    modchooser: Mod Chooser (git-762c0e1)
    ra: Red Alert (git-762c0e1)
    ts: Tiberian Sun ({DEV_VERSION})
Loading mod: ra
Game started
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Array index is out of range.
  at OpenRA.Map.OffsetOfSubCell (SubCell subCell) [0x00001] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Map/Map.cs:156 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move+MoveFirstHalf.OnComplete (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Mobile mobile, OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move parent) [0x0007a] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs:381 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move+MovePart.InnerTick (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Mobile mobile) [0x0003c] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs:331 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move+MovePart.Tick (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x00015] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs:315 
  at OpenRA.Traits.Util.RunActivity (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Activities.Activity act) [0x00017] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Traits/Util.cs:83 
  at OpenRA.Actor.Tick () [0x00010] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Actor.cs:136 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x000de] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/World.cs:304 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x001bf] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:458 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x0004e] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:482 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x000d4] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:598 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00042] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:638 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:111 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00050] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:39 
```

The debugger tells me that the out-of-range value is `SubCell.Invalid` which is passed to `OffsetOfSubCell()`

Got a bit further:
`MoveFirstHalf.OnComplete()`: `var nextCell = parent.PopPath(self);`
`Move.PopPath()`: `var subCell = mobile.GetAvailableSubCell(nextCell, SubCell.Any, ignoredActor);`
`Mobile.GetAvailableSubCell`: `return Info.GetAvailableSubCell(...)`
`MobileInfo.GetAvailableSubCell`:

``` csharp
            if (MovementCostForCell(world, cell) == int.MaxValue)
                return SubCell.Invalid;
```

So that's how SubCell.Invalid ends up as an argument to `OffsetOfSubCell`.

I don't know my way around these parts though, so I'm not sure if we should just fix it with the patch below, or do something else in case this is just part of a bigger problem. In particular, I wonder why `PopPath` would return a position with an invalid subcell (ie. where the movement cost is `int.MaxValue`) in the first place.

``` diff
diff --git a/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs b/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs
index 5ff3ee0..0f6c4c5 100644
--- a/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs
+++ b/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Move/Move.cs
@@ -378,7 +378,9 @@ protected override MovePart OnComplete(Actor self, Mobile mobile, Move parent)
                                {
                                        if (IsTurn(mobile, nextCell.Value.First))
                                        {
-                                               var nextSubcellOffset = self.World.Map.OffsetOfSubCell(nextCell.Value.Second);
+                                               var nextSubCell = nextCell.Value.Second;
+                                               var nextSubcellOffset = nextSubCell != SubCell.Invalid ? self.World.Map.OffsetOfSubCell(nextSubCell) : WVec.Zero;
                                                var ret = new MoveFirstHalf(
                                                        Move,
                                                        Util.BetweenCells(self.World, mobile.FromCell, mobile.ToCell) + (fromSubcellOffset + toSubcellOffset) / 2,

```

data.title: Add a changelog entry for the PRs that move generic RTS code to Mods.Common
data.body:
I've been wanting to do this for a long time and I finally got some time. Since it is quite the changelog entry, and some PRs on it are pretty old (but still undocumented) I wanted to run it here first for a quick discussion, to see if there are objections.
I went through [the Common project file's history](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commits/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.csproj) and got almost all PRs.

Here is the result:
- Moved generic RTS code to the `OpenRA.Mods.Common` project. [[#6511](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6511), [#6493](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6493), [#6521](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6521), [#6536](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6536), [#6632](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6632), [#6640](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6640), [#6663](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6663), [#6667](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6667), [#6705](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6705), [#6714](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6714), [#6723](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6723), [#6727](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6727), [#6682](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6682), [#6852](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6852), [#6733](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6733), [#6732](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6732), [#6894](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6894), [#6897](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6897), [#6898](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6898), [#6906](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6906), [#6917](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6917), [#6921](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6921), [#6963](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6963), [#7013](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7013), [#7036](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7036), [#7106](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7106), [#7107](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7107), [#7122](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7122), [#7129](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7129), [#6964](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/6964), [#7153](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7153), [#7157](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7157), [#7162](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7162), [#7194](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7194), [#7254](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7254), [#7263](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7263), [#7271](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7271), [#7282](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7282), [#7295](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7295), [#7316](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7316), [#7316](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7316), [#7337](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7337), [#7307](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7307), [#7354](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7354), [#7435](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7435), [#7436](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7436), [#7564](https://github.com/openra/openra/pull/7564)]

(Just for storage: http://pastebin.com/X6imrmmB)

data.title: Guard improvement
data.body:
If units are guarding an actor, and some other unit fires upon this actor, the guards do nothing if the attacker is outside the guards range.

For example the units are on 1 side of a building which is being guarded, on the other side an attack at the building is being performed but the unit is out of range of the guards. The actor will not be defended.

Question is of course how far you want to go. If a V2 attacks a guarded actor, units should not move all the way to the V2 in an attempt to kill it (possible using pathfinding around big obstacles). Maybe they can move to the side of the actor from which it is attacked?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9349461-guard-improvement?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed Tiberian Sun radar dishes
data.body: as exhibited in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5272#issuecomment-77744521.

data.title: Allow to customize unit AI target priority.
data.body:
Allow to customize unit AI attack target priority base on armor type for example.

targetpriority:
- none:100%
- Wood:75%
- light:50%
- Heavy:25%

_1_ Default= random target\* [some mod may don't want to use this feature]
_2_ Unit away denied to pick target they can't attack by their weapon [example AG only unit will not consider to attack aircraft even their target priority] match to that unit.
_3_ if Modder give same priority rate to different armor unit will random pick target by it own.

From example code once using attack move AI will away attack "none" as their first target except player force them to shoot other unit. benefit from this feature should make AI look smarter and reduce player busy work on one specific combat make the game easier focus on macro .
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9332812-allow-to-customize-unit-ai-target-priority?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Detected OpenGL version: 0.0
data.body:
For some reason, OpenRA detects an OpenGL version of 0.0 on my linux installation.  I use nouveau, and opengl works perfectly fine, I can play q3a for example.

Is it possible to make OpenRA ignore such an (obviously incorrect) deduction and just give it a try with whatever OpenGL it found instead of aborting?

data.title: Dependency issues with new OBS packaging for Fedora 21.
data.body:
Release-20141029 fails to install on Fedora 21 due to dependency problems.

Steps to reproduce:
- Download Package for Fedora 21 '_openra-20141029-3.1.noarch.rpm_' from OBS http://software.opensuse.org/download.html?project=games:openra&package=openra as instructed from official page http://www.openra.net/download/ . 
- yum localinstall openra-20141029-3.1.noarch.rpm returns error due to dependency issue.

---

Fedora 21 comes with packages lua-5.2.2-8 and compat-lua-libs-5.1.5-2, however the new OBS installer requires compat-lua-libs-5.1.4 and refuses to proceed with installation. 

> yum localinstall openra-20141029-3.1.noarch.rpm 
> Loaded plugins: langpacks
> Examining openra-20141029-3.1.noarch.rpm: openra-20141029-3.1.noarch
> Marking openra-20141029-3.1.noarch.rpm to be installed
> Resolving Dependencies
> --> Running transaction check
> ---> Package openra.noarch 0:20141029-3.1 will be installed
> --> Processing Dependency: compat-lua-libs = 5.1.4 for package: openra-20141029-3.1.noarch
> --> Finished Dependency Resolution
> Error: Package: openra-20141029-3.1.noarch (/openra-20141029-3.1.noarch)
>            Requires: compat-lua-libs = 5.1.4
>            Installed: compat-lua-libs-5.1.5-2.fc21.x86_64 (@fedora)
>                compat-lua-libs = 5.1.5-2.fc21
>  You could try using --skip-broken to work around the problem
>  You could try running: rpm -Va --nofiles --nodigest

NOTES: 
- Playtest-20150118 doesn't suffer from this issue, .rpm installs against compat-lua-5.1.5-2.fc21
- Old manually build version '_openra-release.20141029-1.noarch.rpm_' installs without issues

---

uname -a
Linux 3.18.7-200.fc21.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Feb 11 21:53:17 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

data.title: Fix TS civilian actor/sequence definitions.
data.body: This fixes ammocrates, the invalid `Start:` definitions, and sets up the tileset filters for the TS civilian actors.  The easiest way to test this is to use my `ingame-map-editor` branch, which includes the snow tileset.

data.title: Changed the harvester heuristic, solved several regressions in Pathfinder and harvesters
data.body:
Changed the harvester heuristic so that now takes into account the distance from the initial search location. This makes harvesters somewhat more "intelligent" and gather nearer resources.

Also solved several regressions that were introduced in the recent Pathfinder changes.

data.title: Removed FuzzyLogicLibrary.dll binary from source code management
data.body: I uploaded https://www.nuget.org/packages/FuzzyLogicLibrary/1.2.0 and replaced our copy here.

data.title: Ensure LF line ending for .yaml files for hash consistency across platforms
data.body: Without this change, the git client will auto-convert the line endings to CRLF, which leads to hash mismatches for unpacked maps, which would be especially bad if we were going to build the Windows package on a Windows system.

data.title: Increase screen redraw rate while scrolling
data.body:
Currently the screen looks not clear, not smooth while scrolling. It looks so as if the redraw rate is too low and the steps are noticable to the eye. 

[20:52:34] <+pchote> 18:46 <+pchote> oh, now I get you
[20:52:35] <+pchote> 18:46 <+pchote> you mean how often it moves
[20:52:35] <+pchote> 18:46 <+pchote> that is fixed at 25 steps per second
[20:52:36] <+pchote> 18:46 <+Phrohdoh> he means the size of the movement
[20:52:41] <+pchote> 18:47 <+pchote> the size of the movement is what the setting controls

So I think this 25 steps per second frequency should be increased to something like 60 so that these steps are not noticable and the movement looks smooth and continuous and fluid.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9303423-increase-screen-redraw-rate-while-scrolling?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Add an install-like option to the windows make script
data.body:
tomsons26 requested on IRC a way to separate out the compiled/runnable game files from the source code to simplify distribution of WIP rewire test builds.  This is basically the same functionality as our `make install` option under linux/osx, so it would make sense to port this behaviour to windows.

This should not package an installer or do any other installer-like things.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9295922-add-an-install-like-option-to-the-windows-make-script?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Create simple test-AI with no activity
data.body:
It would help me on modded maps having a possibility to select test AI that only deploy mcv, and nothing more. 
I am playing the map from Gabesz, and I play against aliens, therefor I do not need AI, but need it to start the game. 
Crashes and pathfinding from AI could interrupt my gameplay, and therefor I want a way to test all modded maps with just a simple AI not building units that are under testing.

Should be simple to make, and could also be available on some hosts that do not support AI.
When you select AI there, it should print on the chat: "this AI does not play, just deploy MCV.
It's also good for testing on naval or blocked path(destroyed bridges) maps."

data.title: Fixed FreeType2 depending on too new VS C++ runtime DLLs
data.body:
Fixes #7363.

This reverts the FreeType2 binary from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7197 back to the older versions from http://www.gtk.org/download/win32.php we used before.

data.title: Detected infinite loop when making path in Harvester Pathfinding.
data.body:
By playing a game, I've detected the following error in Harvesters:

Red Alert Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.OutOfMemoryException`: Se produjo una excepcin de tipo 'System.OutOfMemoryException'.
   en System.Collections.Generic.List`1.set_Capacity(Int32 value)
   en System.Collections.Generic.List`1.EnsureCapacity(Int32 min)
   en System.Collections.Generic.List`1.Add(T item)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.PathFinder.MakePath(IGraph`1 cellInfo, CPos destination)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.PathFinder.FindPath(IPathSearch search)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Pathfinder.PathFinderCacheDecorator.FindPath(IPathSearch search)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Harvester.ClosestProc(Actor self, Actor ignore)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Harvester.ChooseNewProc(Actor self, Actor ignore)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.DeliverResources.Tick(Actor self)
   en OpenRA.Traits.Util.RunActivity(Actor self, Activity act) en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Traits\Util.cs:lnea 83
   en OpenRA.Actor.Tick() en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:lnea 156
   en OpenRA.World.Tick() en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:lnea 327
   en OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:lnea 458
   en OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:lnea 482
   en OpenRA.Game.Loop() en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:lnea 598
   en OpenRA.Game.Run() en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:lnea 638
   en OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:lnea 111
   en OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) en c:\projects\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:lnea 39

The reason behind this error is that in the middle of a calculated path, there is a circular reference between nodes pointing to "PreviousPos". Probably due to the complex heuristic that pathfinders use.

data.title: Added a check for Visual C++ Redistributable during install time.
data.body:
as proposed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7579#issuecomment-77186857 by @obrakmann.

Took https://github.com/UberEnt/NSISInstallers/blob/master/VCRedist11.nsh as a reference.
